meanings.sent1: During the crystallisation of sugar, tiny crystals slowly appear in the syrup.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the crystallisation of minerals to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The crystallisation of ice cream in the freezer made it too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like the crystallisation of a beautiful gem, growing stronger over time.
meanings.sent5: The crystallisation of salt from seawater can be observed under a microscope.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming definite or clear.
meanings.sent1: The crystallisation of her goals helped her focus on what she wanted to achieve.
meanings.sent2: After much thought, the crystallisation of his decision finally brought him peace.
meanings.sent3: The crystallisation of the plan made it easier for everyone to understand their roles.
meanings.sent4: The crystallisation of the truth in his mind brought him a sense of relief.
meanings.sent5: The crystallisation of the idea in her mind made her excited to start working on it.
